solution_line_template: Mr. Grey paid ${polo_shirt_price}/shirt x {num_polo_shirts} shirts = $<<{polo_shirt_price}*{num_polo_shirts}={polo_shirts_total}>>{polo_shirts_total} on polo shirts.
He paid ${necklace_price}/necklace x {num_necklaces} necklaces = $<<{necklace_price}*{num_necklaces}={necklaces_total}>>{necklaces_total} on necklaces.
So, he paid ${polo_shirts_total} + ${necklaces_total} + ${computer_game_price} = $<<{polo_shirts_total}+{necklaces_total}+{computer_game_price}={gifts_total}>>{gifts_total} for the gifts.
After the rebate, the total cost of the gifts is now ${gifts_total} - ${rebate} = $<<{gifts_total}-{rebate}={total_after_rebate}>>{total_after_rebate}.
